page.title: 02 THE MOSSES CENTRE
page.content: The Mosses Youth and Community Centre was built in 1973 and is open seven days a week. Thirty people work there, helping to provide a warm, friendly atmosphere. There are 2000 members - from 18 months to 84 years. During the day it is used by school leavers on a "Life and Social Skills" course. A Pre-school playgroup is held every week-day morning and many clubs and societies meet in the evening. These include {chess, amateur radio, {home-brewing, advanced drivers, sub- } {aqua, lip reading, gymnastics, dancing and many more. The cost to run this centre is Â£88,000 per annum. { } B.G.S (Girls) Prep Dept. Holy Trinity C.E. Primary.
